segments.en: 12. The World and the Kinds of Sensual Stimulation

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

segments.pli: Atha kho pañcasikho gandhabbadevaputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho pañcasikho gandhabbadevaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: And then the fairy Pañcasikha went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti?
segments.en: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life?

segments.pli: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
segments.en: What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life?”
“Pañcasikha, there are sights known by the eye …

segments.pli: santi kho, pañcasikha, manoviññeyyā dhammā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them,

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: their consciousness relies on that and grasps it.
A mendicant with grasping does not become extinguished.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, pañcasikha, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti.
segments.en: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life.

segments.pli: Santi ca kho, pañcasikha, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā … pe …
segments.en: There are sights known by the eye …

segments.pli: santi kho, pañcasikha, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato na tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti, na tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them, their consciousness doesn’t rely on that and grasp it.
A mendicant free of grasping becomes extinguished.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, pañcasikha, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti.
segments.en: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: The fairy Pañcasikha asks the Buddha why some become awakened in this very life, while others do not.
